channel.title: The Rolistes Podcast
channel.description:
Welcome among The Rolistes…
We are the proudly London-based producers of Tabletop RPG podcasts showcasing fans across the Channel, the Pond and beyond.
We cross borders, languages, fandoms, game systems and settings with unique discoveries in each episode.
Join us for a mix of discussions, RPG actual plays, travel-diaries, vox-populi, movie reviews, and even music by amazing Creative Commons artists.
Meet independent game designers, popular British publishers, immigrants, travellers visiting London or other random encounters made during our travels.
Our content is for YOU, no matter if you are a seasoned grognard or wannabe players who are about to take their first steps in The Hobby.
We are for those curious about what and how tabletop roleplaying games are played across the World, how players can have wildly different walks of life and interests can be.

item.title: Two Years Strong at the Barbican
item.description: Two years! Lot of fun and so many encounters. To celebrate this second birthday, I am joined by Haqadosch who helped me go through our recent survey aimed at finding out which were your favourite songs, collaborators, guests, actual plays and, finally, your very favourite episode. Thanks you listeners for supporting The Rolistes Podcast through your kind words and... Continue reading Two Years Strong at the Barbican

item.title: Hoopod – Kalum – I know how to “red”
item.description:
Been a while since I had the pleasure of joining a fellow podcast and, after much timezone constrained scheduling, it had the great pleasure to join two thirds of Hoopod crew.

Come find out about Team Hooman and a bit more about me.

item.title: Tu Vuo Fa Il Ruolista (at Stratagemma, Florence)
item.description: After the long serie of Nephilim episodes, I needed, and maybe so did you, a little light episode. Let's say a couple random encounters and a couple songs. item.title: Nephilim with Mira, Willem & Rob (Part Three)
item.description: Finally the third and final part of our multiparts episode dedicated to Nephilim, the 90s cult French contemporary occult tabletop RPG, with our guests/players Mira Manga, Willem and Robert. Thanks to all the listeners for their feedback. Congratulations to Moira Omahoni for winning the two tickets to the Shadows of Esteren live classic concert Adeliane at this year's UK Games... item.description: Listen to this little audio announcement to find out how to win one of two tickets for the live performance on Saturday June 3rd at the UK Games Expo of the Shadows of Esteren's soundtrack album Adeliane composed by François Rousselot. Deadline to enter the contest: Sunday May 14th in the Evening. Winners to be announced on May 15th. Tweet... Continue reading Contest Shadows of Esteren UKGE Live Concert

item.title: Nephilim with Mira, Willem & Rob (Part One)
item.description: Nephilim, is one of my all time favourite game. I hope this episode will make you want to have a go yourself at playing those immortal beings condemned, since the fall of Atlantis, into possessing live human beings through the ages, to be trapped in random archaeological trinkets or to dissolve in the magical fields. item.description: Second part of our encounter with Bec Hill, London-based Australian comedian extraordinaire. Also finally our verdict with Persephelia about "Rogue One - A Star Wars Story". item.description: Part 4, this is the end beautiful friend, the end! item.title: System Mastery - Afterthought - Mea Culpa (Nephilim)
item.description: System Mastery is one of the many many excellent tabletop RPG podcasts, I regularly listen to. With each episode, one D6 at a time, System Mastery dive deep in old game books to find out what they are about and whether or not they stand the test of time. item.description: Space... ...The final frontier... Here is finally Episode 16. Apologies for the delay. I happened to be a bit over ambitious with this episode. Over the last few years, Star Trek has grown into something I am really passionate about . I happened also to be extremely lucky with this episode. item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: So it's been a year... I guess it was time to admit The Rolistes Podcast is mostly an ego trip (you probably had figured it out by now) and to finally stop interrupting my guests when they speak... ...by being the guest myself. To be the host of that special episode, I recruited the best available, someone with an... Continue reading The One About Me, Me, Me, Meee... (With Awesome Feats)

item.title: An Evening With Monte Cook & Other RPG Memories
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: It's been almost a year since I started The Rolistes Podcast (more about that in Ep 13) and what a wonderful surprise to receive, at such time, an email from Monte Cook Games suggesting an episode with their podcast savvy co-founder. Unlike what I usually do, I didn't ask Monte Cook many questions about his first experience in tabletop... Continue reading An Evening With Monte Cook & Other RPG Memories

item.title: Never Got Around To It -Sandman, Meandering and Complaining About Meandering
item.description: Bret from Never Got Around To It podcast was kind enough to be the very first podcast to invite me as guest. I find the concept of his show very cool. Guest are invited to pick something they should have read, watched or played for a long time, do so and come to the show to discuss their overdue... item.title: Supaéro Roleplaying Aircraft Engineers (also we checked-out Warcraft)
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: For episode 11, let's meet Fouc from "Supaéro". This respected French aerospace engineering school has not only spawned Serge Dassault and a couple astronauts but also a successful roleplaying conventions and many RPG writers. We also discussed London's famous live action events, Secret Cinema, which brought its audience in the middle of Dr Strangelove missile crisis and Back To... item.title: Modiphius' Chris Birch & Unrelated Birthday Shenanigans (incl. Captain America: Civil War)
item.description: Meet Chris Birch, the fellow gamer behind the success of British publisher Modiphius, and in recent years Dragonmeet. Thanks to our regular guest Garry, from The Role Play Haven, for making that interview possible. Chris tells us about his journey which includes a lot of old school gaming, as well as the development, among other things, of Star Blazer Adventures and  Kickstarter... item.title: Foodie, Geeky, Fantasy & RPG Stew
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: Food! Isn’t that the greatest thing in life? Don’t you think the pleasure of gathering around a table to share breakfast, second breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner has a lot in common with the pleasure of gathering around a table for a good session of tabletop RPG? Actually, I am just looking for a justification (no matter how flimsy)... Continue reading Foodie, Geeky, Fantasy & RPG Stew

item.title: Dungeons & Dragons Explained And Other Random Encounters
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: Dungeons & Dragons ! Most famous and sometimes infamous of all tabletop roleplaying games. The number One both in time and success. With this belated Episode 8, we try to come back to the basics. First, The Rolistes Podcast introduces you to Aora, one of London's friendliest roleplaying expat. Second, through our discussion with Aora, and many other random encounters,... Continue reading Dungeons & Dragons Explained And Other Random Encounters

item.title: A Dragonmeet of Ice & Fire
item.category: A Song of Ice and Fire
item.description: Have you been to Dragonmeet yet? If you did, you already know how much fun it is to attend this event. If you didn't, do not worry. You don't have to wait for next year's edition to enjoy a slice of London's largest tabletop gaming convention. We head to a very northern and windy destination, on a mission to find a... item.title: A Most Spoilery Star Wars Episode
item.description: Star Wars The Force Awakens is finally upon us ! While (not really at the same time) we're heading with Persephelia for the BFI Imax, Garry and James, from Role Play Haven, join me to celebrate this long awaited event with a not so little discussion about our Star Wars memories, tabletop RPG related or not. We also discuss... Continue reading A Most Spoilery Star Wars Episode

item.title: Special James Bond
item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: For the release of S.P.E.C.T.R.E., we seize the opportunity with episode 5 to celebrate the most famous of all Britons: James Bond. We head with the team, Haqadosh, Xany, Toto Chan and Persephelia to the Marble Odeon to find out how Bond's latest adventure fares. Also, Garry and James from Role Play Haven are back to discuss the special agent's place... Continue reading Special James Bond

item.category: Guilde des Rolistes Francophones de Londres
item.description: ITunes.  With episode 4, it is my great pleasure to introduce the listeners of The Rolistes Podcast to London's largest, and extremely friendly, gaming role playing club: Role Play Haven. item.description: With episode 2, The Rolistes Podcast is messier than ever and heavy on the French accent. Apologies,we are still getting our act sorted. Together with Xany and Haqadosch we find out that recording a podcast while attempting to play board games is a bad idea. In addition to the next segment of our interview with Kundin, we did manage... Continue reading Mess' Up, Arrow, Luchadores & Asian Restaurants
